title: 'It's beyond demonic': Jim Breuer describes his experience with a child predator at SNL
description:
Child sexual predators have been in the news lately, especially with the push to drag (pun intended) children to "pride" events with full-on nudity, the burgeoning genre of child drag queen programming, and the insistence from the political left (I'd say radical, but this is pretty much the mainstream position) to force drag shows and queer culture on children. It's disgusting. It's repugnant. It's unconscionable

But comedian Jim Breuer put it even more succinctly and in no uncertain terms: "It's beyond demonic."

That sums it up perfectly. It is demonic. And Breuer, sitting down with Steven Crowder and Dave Landau, explained his experience with the alleged rampant pedophilia in Hollywood.

Jim Runs Into a Child Predator at SNL... | Louder With Crowder youtu.be

"The term pedophilia should just be called 'child f*cking,' and then you'll think of it differently."

Yes, we would think of it differently. We might, as a nation, take it more seriously and treat it with the kind of severity it deserves. But this is a country being overrun by leftist progressivism (read regressivism), which seeks to mainstream this brutal, abusive, degenerate behavior. It seeks to make excuses and play words games to sneak it past less discerning people.

But decent Americans--decent human beings--understand that child f*cking is wrong. We understand the need to protect children from the leftists who want to sexually indoctrinate and g-word them. Decent Americans need to start voting for the kind of leaders who also want to protect children, not for the Democrats who pal around with drag queens in their free time and stump against legislation meant to keep g-worders from getting their iridescent rainbow-colored claws into children.

There's no place in a moral nation for people who would abuse children. As Dave says, "It should be called 'corpse.' Just kill 'em. [...] Shallow grave."

Breuer/Landau 2024!

title: The end of hookup culture? Dating app survey says singles are looking for more
description:
So, finally, a little bit of good news we can attribute to younger people! It doesn't happen often, so let's all take a moment to give the nearest Gen Zer a pat on the head and a thumbs up.

According to a survey from the online dating app Hinge, dating preferences and behaviors, particularly those of Gen Zers, have changed, rejecting hookup culture and focusing on long-term romantic relationships with "someone with whom they share a deeper connection."

Some of the statistics, derived from a survey of Hinge app users, look rather promising:

  • 45% of users have changed their dating habits
  • 39% report being pickier about their partner
  • 91% say they don't want to waste their time on the wrong person
The New York Post reports that "many Hinge users reported they had learned to be more honest about their feelings."
“Make sure you talk early on in the dating journey about your goals and values,” says Logan Ury, director of relationship science at Hinge. “It can be hard to bring up, but if it turns out you’re not on the same page, it will save you a lot of time and heartbreak long-term.”
Now, I'm not going to recommend it to everyone--because I have actually received some angry messages for it--but I used Hinge, and having something like this on my profile managed to weed out MANY of the, how should I say, bad apples.

And yes, it worked. She's great. And stay away from her, she's taken. Obviously.

Hey, far be it for me to tell people how to go about dating, but I hope that the data from the survey is evidence of a trend that will only continue. Nothing good has come out of the left's push for sexual liberation, and there's something to be said about pursuing only a healthy, fulfilling, and fruitful relationship with a person with whom one can actually see a future. That's a good thing. It's what everyone should be looking for.

title: Volleyball player accuses attendee of yelling racial slur, liberal media freaks out... but it never happened
description:
If anyone wonders why it's impossible to take the legacy media seriously, it's because they lie. And when they aren't overtly lying, they're twisting the truth so much it should be called lying. And when they aren't doing that, they're jumping on a story to push their narrative without waiting for any verification just because, well, they don't care if things are true, just that they can use it...

Such was the case last week when a Duke University volleyball player named Rachel Richardson claimed that someone in the crowd attending the match yelled a racial slur "every time she served." She additionally alleged that she was "threatened by a white male that told her to watch her back going to the team bus."

According to The Blaze, Richardson said in a statement: "My fellow African American teammates and I were targeted and racially heckled throughout the entirety of the match. The slurs and comments grew into threats which caused us to feel unsafe."

The left-wing media immediately ran with it. (h/t Twitchy)

Duke player allegedly target of racial slur during BYU volleyball game.

MORE HERE: https://t.co/BAzEKKIIzj pic.twitter.com/4nzC8vKhoj
— Good Morning America (@GMA) August 30, 2022
"I have 4 daughters that play the game, 3 at the college level. We've always had that occasional idiot in the crowd, but never an atmosphere like this."

-- Marvin Richardson, father of Duke volleyball player Rachel Richardson who was called racial slurs during a match at BYU pic.twitter.com/vFztPJQbt4
— Brianna Keilar (@brikeilarcnn) August 29, 2022
Wrote something about the racial slurs hurled against Duke volleyball player Rachel Richardson at BYU, the times 5 decades ago when Black athletes first confronted racism at the school and paid a heavy price, and of course how the past is not always past. https://t.co/jSO6SLj7C8
— Dave Zirin (@EdgeofSports) August 30, 2022
A young Black woman named Rachel Richardson is a victim, but she's also more than that. She's a hero surrounded by a lot of people who failed her.

The latest column from @mikefreemanNFL: https://t.co/VEIgSQvguw
— USA TODAY Sports (@usatodaysports) August 28, 2022

But, uh, it wasn't f*ckin' true!

If the left-wing media had only bothered to take a moment to unwad their panties, remove their heads from their a**ses, and take a deep breath, they might have calmed down long enough to think about looking into the allegations. And even if that wasn't going to happen, the process of removing their heads from their a**ses may have taken long enough for the truth to come out and prevent them from throwing their ignorant hissy fits!

According to the BYU Cougar Chronicle, numerous sources, from BYU athletic department staff to several people who were in attendance, seated throughout the section from which Richardson alleges the slurs were yelled, have stated that no such thing was ever screamed. Apparently, we're to believe this single volleyball player, standing on the court, heard a slur yelled repeatedly from the stands while not a single person seated anywhere in the crowd heard a thing. Even those people who were seated beside the court heard nothing.

A review of video taken of the match failed to provide any evidence of the alleged incident, too.

Has the media come out to apologize? No.

A fan, however, was banned from attending BYU games after Duke players identified him by the sound of his voice... For an alleged incident that has no corroborating evidence...

Because when the left comes for you, they don't need evidence. Nothing need actually occur. They just need to cry loud enough.

title: The trailer for the live-action Winnie the Pooh horror movie 'Blood and Honey' dropped and... dude
description:
I don't know where the trend started that we need gritty remakes of childhood classics. But, this is a thing we do now. The latest entry to the genre is the childhood classic Winnie the Pooh, which turns him into a loveable, huggable psychopath in Blood and Honey. It looks like something that if the Toxic Avenger read a story to children, this would be the story. When I first read about it, I was hoping it wasn't true. Now, there is a trailer.

Why is Winnie the Pooh killing people?

"Pooh, Piglet, Eeyore, we were friends for many years, and they're out there"

Watch the disturbing new trailer for Winnie the Pooh: Blood and Honey, which takes a violent new turn on the classic story. pic.twitter.com/IRMtrJazDD
— IGN (@IGN) August 31, 2022

As far as I can tell, it's not unlike my favorite meme.

Christopher Robin left his friends behind and met a girl. Winnie the Pooh doesn't handle rejection well. Something snapped in Pooh Bear. Then when Christopher Robin took his fiance to meet his friends, it was too little too later. Pooh was out for blood. And honey.

Piglet is still with him, though he's gone berzerk, as well. It doesn't look like Eeyore survived. Whether he died of natural causes or Pooh couldn't take his "woe is me" schtick anymore is unclear. Maybe Pooh and Piglet gave him the "squeal like a pig" treatment from Deliverance. We don't talk about what happened to Eeyore.

There is also a group of hot chicks in a house. Not sure of the connection, other than every movie should have a group of hot chicks in a house. Pooh and Piglet don't want them there. There might be a social justice message about deforestation or gentrification.

Not sure when the movie is being released. I only know I'll be hate watching it.

title: Californians told not to charge their electric vehicles days after state announced a ban on gas-powered cars
description:
Life comes at you pretty fast. On August 26, a group of government bureaucrats voted to ban gas-powered cars in California by 2035. Six days later, Californians are told not to power their electric vehicles because the grid is too weak.

Last week, California announced a ban on sale of gas-powered cars by 2035.

This week, they're telling people not to charge their electric vehicles. https://t.co/8isPS3dGUD
— John Cooper (@thejcoop) August 31, 2022

The non-profit American Public Power Association issued a warning that because California is going to be very hot this weekend, residents may be using too much electricity. All the astronomical taxes Californians pay haven't been going toward making a strong grid, and it might not be able to handle the extra wattage. Citizens are strongly urged to adhere to the "Flex Alert" from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm, which means setting your thermostat to 78 degrees or higher (f*ck that), turning off unnecessary lights, and avoiding using large appliances and charging electric vehicles.

Critics are laughing their asses off at California's troubles because, five short days ago, the virtue-signaling California Air Resources Board (CARB) announced that gas-powered vehicles will be banned by 2035. CARB made their decision by ignoring the experts who say that's not possible. See, we only have to follow the EXPERTS if the EXPERTS support whatever the progressive agenda is that week.

Californians who drive gas-powered vehicles are NOT limited from filling up their cars with gasoline from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm. At this time, LWC is unable to confirm if a group of drivers will be burning rubber outside of blacked-out houses from 4:00 pm to 9:00 pm just to be spiteful.

"But Brodigan, I don't live in California. I live in a non-socialist state. Why do I care about the socialist state?"

Because where do you think socialists in other states and Washington, DC, get their ideas from? Case in point: CARB's decision is screwing Virginia. When Democrats ran the state, they voted to give away any decision-making of their own and in 2021 passed a law requiring the state to adopt the same automobile standards as those adopted by CARB. Do you know if your state made a similar boneheaded move?

California's bad ideas become America's bad ideas while people pretend California doesn't exist. That's why we need to pay attention. We can still laugh at Califonia's misery in the meantime.

title: Times Square's new foolproof way to enforce gun laws? 'Gun Free Zone' signs. No, really.
description:
The reason why satire gets fact-checked, other than "independent" "fact" checkers being partisan douchelords, is because so much of what the left does sounds like satire. If you would have told me that New York City's plan to enforce gun laws is to hang "Gun-Free Zone" signs in Times Square, I'd have laughed at your joke. Then I would remember the Buffalo shooter chose Buffalo because it was a gun-free zone, and it should stop being funny.

It's even less funny once you read that's actually the plan.

New York City will begin posting signs proclaiming Times Square a “Gun Free Zone.”

It will be one of scores of “sensitive” places that would be off limits for guns under a new state law meant to address a Supreme Court decision expanding gun rights. https://t.co/Pa9h8qBdvd
— The Associated Press (@AP) August 30, 2022

It's part of New York's soon-to-be unconstitutional gun laws that go into effect on Thursday. After SCOTUS ruled states could no longer require applicants to prove they had “proper cause” to ask for a gun permit, New York Gov. Leroy Jenkins-Hochul signed a slew of new insane gun restrictions. The new laws include having to turn over your social media history to apply for a permit. No, seriously. "As part of that assessment of good character, the bill says, the applicant has to turn over a list of any social media accounts they have had in the past three years 'to confirm the information regarding the applicant’s character and conduct.'”

Another one is to label "sensitive areas" into which you can't bring a gun. One of those sensitive areas is all of Times Square. Because New York Democrats get each other off with they find new ways to limit freedoms in the state.

In all fairness, New Yorkers aren't without any freedoms. You're free to abort a baby up until the doctor delivers the final ten-second countdown. Pre-teens can have their genitals mutilated behind their parents' backs as long as they tell a teachers' union member first. Criminals have the right to commit crimes IN TIMES SQUARE because they know the Hochul Democrats won't punish them and will let them back out onto the street if they promise never to do it again. Criminals also have the freedom to promise never to do it again every time they get caught breaking that promise.

But you don't have the freedom to carry a firearm to protect you and your loved ones from the crime-invested suckhole NYC is turning into. The sign says so.

title: Watch: Father shoots daughter's ex-boyfriend as he tries to break into house
description:
The second amendment is paramount. It is meant to allow people to protect themselves. Primarily, it forces the government to think twice about devolving into despotism, but it also allows citizens to protect themselves from all who would do them harm, like James Rayl, who was plugged full of holes as he attempted to break through a door to get to his ex-girlfriend.

Allyson Duckro had broken up with Rayl over a year before this incident, reports the Daily Mail, but on July 31, he attempted to force his way into Duckro's family home. Luckily, Mitchell Duckro, Allyson's father, was there with access to a 9-mm pistol registered to his father-in-law. Video captured by the home's Ring doorbell shows Rayl attempting to ram through the front door of the home before being shot several times through the door. [WARNING: GRAPHIC]

Look, I'm okay with this. If you're committing any crime, I think you're taking your life in your own hands. Frankly, if it were me inside that house, I wouldn't have waited nearly as long before letting loose with a good ol' can of F*ck Off SprayTM.

Now, Duckro isn't about to face criminal charges. A grand jury already voted not to indict him based on Ohio's "Stand Your Ground Law." And that's good. That's how this should go. It isn't stopping Rayl's family from screaming murder. "Rayl's family have launched a 'Justice for James' campaign, saying he was 'murdered' by Duckro and that 'justice will be served.'"

Justice was served. And while I understand Rayl's family is upset, he was obviously out to do something, and he it was a good shoot.

The headline at the Daily Mail, however, reads like something meant to malign Duckro. It reads, "Ohio father, 52, LAUGHS in interview with cops hours after shooting dead his daughter's ex-boyfriend when he tried to storm their home and admits the firearm wasn't registered to him." Yeah, it's a mouthful. It's also misleading.

The firearm being registered to him is immaterial. He was still in lawful possession of the firearm. And while he laughs, watch this interview and you tell me if he's laughing like the maniacal, cold-blooded killer the headline makes him out to be. [Note: the laugh comes in the last few seconds of the interview and isn't even in relation to the shooting itself.]

He laughs in regards to the notion that a teenage girl would talk to her father about her dating life. That's laughable.

Frankly, if it were me, I might chuckle in relief. The guy deserved what he got. Someone get Mr. Duckro a new, shiny "#1 Dad" mug and a cold beer with which to fill it.

title: 'We've been voting Dem for 59 years': Charles Barkley goes off on Democrats failing the black community
description:
I can never say no to a clip of Charles Barkley talking about politics. He hates everyone, which, in politics, is the right attitude to have. A buddy of mine just shared this clip from the Ryan Clark podcast last May, where Sir Charles said people need to handle their own business because Democrats and Republicans are both full of sh*t.

The clip talks specifically about black voters voting Democrat. But his advice about not trusting either party is universal,

Charles Barkley - “The Democrats & Republicans are both full of s**t..I voted Democratic my entire life & I’m [thinking] man, everybody in my hometown is still poor. The black neighborhoods are still poor. They going to sh***y schools & we been voting Democratic for 59 years.” pic.twitter.com/NiwQqm2fiX
— Darvio Morrow (@DTheKingpin) August 30, 2022

"I voted Democratic my entire life [...] and I'm starting to think, 'Man, everyone in my hometown is still poor. Man, all the black neighborhoods are still poor. They're all going to sh*tty schools, and we've been voting Democratic for 59 years. [...] If you're waiting on these political parties to make your life better, you're just wrong."

It's hard to make the case that Republicans are the ones looking out for rich folks as Democrats continue to make life more unaffordable for the middle class and just paid off their upper-class supporters on the backs of the working class. Also, Republicans aren't the ones telling him he can't talk about those big ol' San Antonio women anymore.

But Sir Charles' point that you shouldn't blindly trust any political party is spot on. Republicans promise conservatives the world. Yet, elect Republicans in the most Republican states in America, and they'll still sell you out even on issues that unite everyone.

Politicians look out for themselves. The parties look out for politicians. Left or right, white or black, it behooves all of us to remember that.

title: Watch: Police pelted with rocks because they dared enforce the law and broke up an illegal street race
description:
Welcome to Chicago, a place that critics call the crime and murder capital of the midwest. Where progressive voters who reelect the same failed progressive leaders over and over again cry out, "Why won't someone do something?!" Well, here are people doing something. Here are police breaking up an illegal street race... and being pelted with rocks for their trouble.

View this post on Instagram
A post shared by PPV-TAHOE (@ppv_tahoe)

A caption with the video says police tried to respond to reports of more drifting and drag racing. Last weekend, one of these illegal races left a woman dead. The city has imposed a crackdown on these street takeovers. Police were sent to break this one up.

Instead, police left with six squad vehicles pummeled by heavy objects like rocks and street signs.

David Brown, Police Superintendent, said at a press conference Monday, "We will hold you accountable for this behavior, regardless of when. We are going to be relentless in identifying you. As long as there are no consequences, this behavior will continue."

This is the same Chicago police that Mayor Lori Lightfoot demanded ask permission before they pursue a suspect on foot. So, it's unclear how criminals will be held accountable or, if the police manage to hold criminals accountable, whether or not city leaders will have their backs.

The lax enforcement of laws in Chicago is causing small business owners to move their businesses elsewhere. Criminals are so empowered in Chicago that someone flashed a gun behind a reporter just because he could. And that reporter was reporting on gun crime at the time.

You get the cities you vote for. Chicsago voters keep voting for this city.

title: 'Don't hire catholics': School official busted admitting how they indoctrinate kids, don't hire conservatives
description:
Memo to school officials: We know what you do behind the scenes and what you think of people who hold opposing viewpoints. However, you'd be doing yourselves a favor by NOT being so cavalier about it aloud. Because it's one thing to assume you indoctrinate students and refuse to hire conservatives, but it's another thing in the case of Greenwich Connecticut Assistant Principal Jeremy Boland. And knowing how Project Veritas operates, Jeremy won't be the only public school official we need to explain this to.

As you review this video, ponder to yourself what the response is going to be: "I was taken out of context" or "We've placed him on paid leave pending a full investigation."

PART 1: Connecticut Public School Asst. Principal Admits Discrimination Against Catholic Candidates youtu.be

It's not what Boland says. I know that you know that this is what happens behind the scenes. It's the cavalier, nonchalant way in which he says it, as if this is the standard way of doing things. And it is so accepted that there is no argument about the matter. "More progressive teachers are actually more savvy about delivering a Democratic message without really ever having to mention politics." So, you're admitting you hire teachers based on their politics and the politicos they are going to push on captive students.

I mean, really dude?

“The conservative teacher, who is stuck in her ways. I’ll never be able to fire her, and I’ll never be able to change her."

"If someone is raised hardcore Catholic, it’s like, they’re brainwashed--you can never change their mindset."

The only thing surprising to me is that a Connecticut public school would hire a teacher who practices any religion. Though, I am curious how they weed out the Catholics from the Protestants. You wouldn't think a New England public school board administrator would know the difference. Maybe he starts the interview by saying, "Peace be with you," to see who gives the Pavlovian response.

As we keep seeing in recent elections, education is the force driving voters to the polls. And that's just parents who assume public school administrators hate them. Having video evidence makes it difficult for schools to claim otherwise.
